title: Medical Treatment Long Stay Visa (subclass 685)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Medical Treatment Long Stay Visa (subclass 685) Page Content ​​ The Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) closed to new applications on 23 March 2013. You might be able to get a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602) If you already have the Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685), it will be valid until the expiry date you were given when your visa was granted. Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) or for people who applied for the visa before it was closed to new applications and for which a decision has not yet been made. It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long your visa lasts Details The Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) lasts until the date we gave you in the letter telling you were granted the visa. The intent is to give you time to have your medical treatment. Extending your stay Details You can apply for a further visa: if medical treatment will continue beyond your visa’s expiry date for a holiday, sightseeing, to visit friends or relatives or for other purposes. You must apply for and be granted your next visa before your current visa ends. What this visa lets you do Details This visa allows you to: stay in Australia for medical treatment study for up to three months, unless you are younger than 18 years old and your circumstances change while you are in Australia and there are compelling and compassionate circumstances for your need to study or train for more than three months. Your support Details If you already hold this visa, the following people might be able to join you in Australia by applying for a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602): someone who wants to come with you to give you emotional and other support while you have your treatment. These people can apply for a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602) using: Form 48ME Application to visit Australia for medical treatment In Australia: Post or fax your application to the Canberra office in Australian Capital Territory - attention Specialist Temporary Entry Centre. You can pay by credit card, debit card, bank cheque or money order made payable to the Department of Home Affairs. Outside Australia: Lodge your application at one of the immigration offices outside Australia Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. You cannot work in Australia, except under limited circumstances. You can study for up to three months unless exceptions apply. Leave before your visa ends Details You are expected to leave Australia before your visa ends. You might be able to apply for another visa in Australia if you need more medical treatment. Medical Treatment visas are usually granted for a short time only, and you are expected to return to your home country. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Medical Treatment Long Stay Visa (subclass 685)

Medical Treatment Long Stay Visa (subclass 685)
Page Content

​​

​​

The Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) closed to new applications on 23 March 2013. You might be able to get aMedical Treatment visa (subclass 602).

The Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) closed to new applications on 23 March 2013. You might be able to get a
Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602)
.

If you already have the Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685), it will be valid until the expiry date you were given when your visa was granted.

If you already have the Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685), it will be valid until the expiry date you were given when your visa was granted.

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) or for people who applied for the visa before it was closed to new applications and for which a decision has not yet been made. It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have already been granted a Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) or for people who applied for the visa before it was closed to new applications and for which a decision has not yet been made. It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

The Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) lasts until the date we gave you in the letter telling you were granted the visa. The intent is to give you time to have your medical treatment.

The Medical Treatment Long Stay visa (subclass 685) lasts until the date we gave you in the letter telling you were granted the visa. The intent is to give you time to have your medical treatment.

### Extending your stay

Extending your stay
Details

You can apply for a further visa:

You can apply for a further visa:
- if medical treatment will continue beyond your visa’s expiry date
if medical treatment will continue beyond your visa’s expiry date
- for a holiday, sightseeing, to visit friends or relatives or for other purposes.
for a holiday, sightseeing, to visit friends or relatives or for other purposes.

You must apply for and be granted your next visa before your current visa ends.

You must apply for and be granted your next visa before your current visa ends.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This visa allows you to:

This visa allows you to:
- stay in Australia for medical treatment
stay in Australia for medical treatment
- study for up to three months, unless you are younger than 18 years old and your circumstances change while you are in Australia and there are compelling and compassionate circumstances for your need to study or train for more than three months.
study for up to three months, unless you are younger than 18 years old and your circumstances change while you are in Australia and there are compelling and compassionate circumstances for your need to study or train for more than three months.

### Your support

Your support
Details

If you already hold this visa, the following people might be able to join you in Australia by applying for a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602):

If you already hold this visa, the following people might be able to join you in Australia by applying for a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602):
- someone who wants to come with you to give you emotional and other support while you have your treatment.
someone who wants to come with you to give you emotional and other support while you have your treatment.

These people can apply for a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602) using:

These people can apply for a Medical Treatment visa (subclass 602) using:
- Form 48ME Application to visit Australia for medical treatment
Form 48ME Application to visit Australia for medical treatment

In Australia:

In Australia:

Post or fax your application to theCanberra officein Australian Capital Territory - attention Specialist Temporary Entry Centre. You can pay by credit card, debit card, bank cheque or money order made payable to the Department of Home Affairs.

Post or fax your application to the
Canberra office
in Australian Capital Territory - attention Specialist Temporary Entry Centre. You can pay by credit card, debit card, bank cheque or money order made payable to the Department of Home Affairs.

Outside Australia:

Outside Australia:

Lodge your application at one of theimmigration offices outside Australia.

Lodge your application at one of the
immigration offices outside Australia
.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. You cannot work in Australia, except under limited circumstances. You can study for up to three months unless exceptions apply.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. You cannot work in Australia, except under limited circumstances. You can study for up to three months unless exceptions apply.

#### Leave before your visa ends

Leave before your visa ends
Details

You are expected to leave Australia before your visa ends. You might be able to apply for another visa in Australia if you need more medical treatment. Medical Treatment visas are usually granted for a short time only, and you are expected to return to your home country.

You are expected to leave Australia before your visa ends. You might be able to apply for another visa in Australia if you need more medical treatment. Medical Treatment visas are usually granted for a short time only, and you are expected to return to your home country.

#### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.
